1.content:
The cool night did nothing to deter Bill from finding a new watering hole. He had just moved out to this small town to get away from his gold-digging ex and away from the fast-paced city life. He worked too hard for too many years and was going to enjoy his early retirement.

Taking a leisurely drive around town Bill discovered what looked to be a biker bar on the outskirts. The plain-looking brick building had several motorcycles in the lot and a few men hanging around outside. After pulling into the parking lot, Bill could make out the sign dimly lit by flickering lights. Jotunheim. 'Interesting name,' he thought. The men hovering around a few of the bikes were large, much bigger than the shorter Bill. And while Bill was fit, he wasn't nearly as wide as some of the men either. Some were a more muscular stocky build, some were on the chubbier side, but all of them were large.

The men all eyed Bill as he climbed out of his pick-up truck. The leering bikers seemed strangely interested in him. Bill shivered, chilled by their hungry gazes more than the cool night air. Doing his best to ignore the stares, he walked up to the door. At the entrance was an immense man, presumably the bouncer. He had a wide, thick build. Bill figured he spent most of his off hours in the gym. The huge bouncer wasn't cut though, he went for mass, and he had a lot of it. Despite the night temperature, the bouncer wore only a leather vest, jeans, and heavy leather boots, as well as a gold chain with some kind of locket. The cool air didn't seem to perturb him at all. This put the bouncers wide, heavy, hairy pecs and gut on display. Red fur covered much of the large man's skin. His hair on his head was close-cropped and he had thick mutton chops on his cheeks, leaving the lip and chin bare except for a bit of stubble.

The bouncer gazed intently at Bill, though it looked more out of curiosity than hungry lust. The bouncer stood up and blocked Bill's path. The shorter man noticed with some trepidation that he only came up to the bottom of the bouncer's pecs.

"Hey there," came a deep rumbling voice as the bouncer spoke. "I need to see your ID if you plan on entering Jotunheim." The burly redhead simply stood there with his arms crossed as Bill fished out his driver's license. The bouncer causally took the ID and glanced at the birthday, smiling. Then unexpectedly he slipped the license inside his vest.

"Hey, what are you..."

"Keys too. We won't have any drunk drivers leaving here."

"What? That ridiculous. No place does anything like that!"

"Our place, our rules. If you want in, you give me your keys. You'll get them back along with your license when you leave Jotunheim." The bouncer smirked as he said that. "Of course, once you step inside you might find it hard to leave." The hefty redhead placed a heavy hand on Bill's shoulder, almost as if he didn't want him to back out of going inside the bar. The men were hot and Bill's curiosity was growing, so he complied and fished out his keys from his pocket and handed them over. The bouncer took them and placed them in his own pocket.

"Now then, you're free to enter. However, if you're willing to wait, my shift ends in 20 minutes and I'd love to show you the place." Bill noticed the bouncer's eyes took on a bit of lust. "Up to you."

Bill...

113.content:
Bill found himself gazing at the the heavyset giant a couple tables away. The man was massive; he must have weighed over 300 pounds. He wasn't as solid as some of the other guys here, but he carried his weight well. The first thing Bill saw were the heavy black motorcycle boots. Extending up from there were the denim-clad cliffs that were the biker's legs. The tiny man saw a hairy paw resting on one of the thighs with a black leather wristband behind it. Beyond that was a chubby arm covered in thick dark hairs. It was hard for Bill to see more as the table was blocking much of the view. Bill tentatively approached the giant, unsure of how he would react to finding a little man.

Bill stuck to the wall as he made his way over to the giant's table. Huge boots were stomping everywhere, making it feel like there was a constant mild earthquake assaulting the bar. From the new perspective farther down the wall Bill could see more of the chubby giant. Continuing up his torso Bill noticed he was wearing an open black leather vest. The giant had no shirt underneath, though from the side he couldn't make out the chest very well, though the large furry gut was obvious. The giant had a massive beard, dense with coarse hairs. The giant had on a black Muir cap and a ring of dark hair along the sides and back.

Bill stood there mesmerized for a moment, lusting over this colossal biker. The tiny man saw the giant glance in his direction, then went back to his drink on the table. Did the giant see him? There was only one way to find out. Bill waited for a moment when his part of the floor was light on traffic and made a dash for the behemoth's table. Just as the little man arrived one of the giant's boots shifted and knocked him over. The huge foot started tapping on the ground; the heavy thuds made it difficult for Bill to get back up.

"Hey! I'm down here! Please don't step on me!" Bill yelled up to the giant. The huge biker looked down quizzically, as if he might have heard something but wasn't quite sure. Not saying a word, the chubby bear reached down and scooped up the little man in a fist, only leaving Bill's head exposed. Bill was brought up before the giant's face as large brown eyes gazed at him with a penetrating stare, evaluating his new capture.

"Did you say something, little man?"

Bill gulped nervously, thoroughly scared now that he was actually in the giant's hand. "I...I said please don't step on me, sir."

"Better," the giant said in dismissive approval. "What brings a lowly creature such as yourself over to my table, little man?"

"I...I...I wanted to meet you, sir."

"Is that so? Well, here you are."

Bill kind of just stared in awe, a bit dumbfounded by his position before realizing he hadn't introduced himself.

"My name is Bill, sir."

"What do you want little man?" The giant appeared to be somewhat irritated. "Tell me before I drop you back on the floor for another giant to find."

"I...I don't know," the tiny man answered honestly. He just knew he was attracted to this dominant giant of a biker.

"Then why are you bothering me if you don't even know why you're here?" The giant slowly swung his hand out over the side of the table. Bill knew the giant wasn't kidding about dropping him. Was the biker really going to drop him to his death?

"I just wanted to be with you!" Bill yelled out in desperation.

"Hmf." The giant swung Bill back up in front of his face. "That's a start. Now for what I want. I want..."

"us to go home." Without saying a word, the chubby biker dumped Bill into an inner vest pocket. The odor of sweat mixed with leather was overpowering; Bill had difficulty breathing in the tight, humid space. At least the vest itself was still open as the giant's belly was too large for it to be buttoned closed. This meant the air circulated a little bit as the biker walked over to meet with the bouncer.

"I believe you have something that belongs to me," Bill heard his owner declare to the bouncer without even so much as a hello.

"I know, sir, I was hoping to get him for myself." Bill was surprised to hear the huge bouncer sound so deferential as well as a bit dejected. The little man couldn't tell what was going on from inside the pocket, but he figured the bouncer was handing something over to his giant.

"You're always welcome to join in the fun."

"Yes, sir, I know. Thank you for the offer. I'll think about it."

"Someday I hope you do decide to take it. I understand why you haven't yet, but you're really missing out, son." Suddenly fingers invaded the tight space and fished Bill out of the pocket. The little man was dangled between the two giants. Bill gasped in awe upon seeing the furry red mountain of a man at this scale. "Maybe this will be enough incentive for you."

The bouncer started to reach out but the chubby giant brought Bill back closer in towards his own body. "No touching. If I didn't like you so much, I'd have you punished for breaching protocol, son. But I'd rather you come willingly." The giant then placed Bill back inside the stuffy vest pocket.

"Thank you, sir. I'm sorry I did that."

"Oh, don't thank me yet. Thank me after you pay me a visit." With that the chubby let out a cruel-sounding chuckle and exited the bar.

"Sir! Sir Byron! Please, wait." Bill and his master, apparently named Byron, heard over the roar of the engine. Byron turned the engine off and kicked the stand back down. The bouncer was standing at the threshold of the bar entrance, his locket dangling from his hand before him. The bouncer took a few steps back into the bar and waited. The chubby biker turned around and saw his new prey waiting for him inside the bar. "Good boy," he mumbled, though it was audible to the tiny Bill. "Looks like you'll have company, little pet." Byron dismounted from his bike and walked into the bar, standing before the beefy ginger bouncer. Byron simply held a hand out with the palm upturned.

The bouncer gently dropped the locket into Byron's hand. "Good boy, Scott. I knew you'd see it my way. Of course, that'll be the last time someone uses your giant name." The bouncer quickly dwindled to a three inch version of himself, ankle-high to the now gigantic biker. "Since you're no longer a giant." Byron pocketed the locket then reached down to pick up his newest pet. "Let's go home, boy." Byron stuffed Scott into the same pocket as Bill, causing the confined space to become even more cramped.

"Why?" Bill asked the new inmate.

"I wasn't supposed to touch another giant's property without permission. Everyone saw that. Master knew my status was undermined. Better to go willingly than have him force the issue as punishment. Besides, I still get you this way, little man." Scott smiled smugly, though it was hidden in the darkness of the pocket.

The pair of little men heard the bike engine roar to life again and felt themselves being taken away from Jotunheim.

It would probably serve him well to keep him happy. Of course the fact that Bill found the man hot weighed heavily into the decision.

Now you're just going to stay here next to me like a good little man. Prove to them you're a good little man and wait by me until my shift is over."

With nothing else to do and no means of escaping if he wanted, Bill quietly waited by the bouncer. The redhead would occasionally rub his hand up and down Bill's back or pull him in to kiss him deeply. The smaller man found himself starting to get turned on by the blatant foreplay. This was starting to turn into a good night out after all, despite the oddity of it.

Before long the 20 minutes had passed and the bouncer got up from his stool. "Now be a good boy and give me a few minutes, then meet me inside. You got that little man?"

Bill nodded in reply. "Yes, sir."

The massive redhead simply stood up and walked away around the side, presumably to the employee entrance. He didn't even look back. While Bill stood outside waiting, the other men outside were glaring at him, some darkly. Obviously they weren't happy, not that Bill cared. He would be glad to get inside and away from them.

Bill could only watch as the colossal biker bent over with an outstretched hand. He was a large, heavyset giant, with a large thick grey beard. Grey hair was on display on the giant's chest as the biker was only wearing a tank top with a black leather vest. Behind the calloused hands were black leather wristbands, and the giant's legs were clad in denim before ending at his booted feet. A black leather hat topped the bald head. Crystal blue eyes practically shone with delight as the giant snatched up the helpless little man from the floor.

Bill nearly got sick as he rocketed up as if he was on some crazy carnival ride. When it stopped, Bill was nauseated and dizzy. The hand opened so that Bill was laying in the giant's palm.

"You're a hot little man. Been a while since I've caught one. Most stick with the giant they meet outside. You're a brave little human to run off on your own. Or foolish!" the older giant laughed. "Tell you what, since it's so dangerous for you to be running about on your own, I'll keep you someplace safe," Bill's hopes got up before the giant added with a hearty laugh, "as part of my collection!"

"No, let me go! Put me down!" Bill screamed, hoping someone would help him. He saw the giant bouncer approach the heavyset biker.

"Damn," the redheaded giant said. "I was hoping to take him home with me." The bouncer knew the rules; possession was nine-tenths the law. That's what he got for toying with the little man. He loved the cat and mouse game but it always cost him the mouse.

1211312.content:
"You can't be serious." Scott protested. "I'm a giant. I can't just become part of your collection."

The biker stepped closer and brought a hand up to the bouncer's broad, meaty chest. Fingers ran up through the red fur as they sought out the locket hanging from the thick neck. The biker casually played with the adornment. "Oh, yes you can. Face it; you're not a very good giant. You've never even captured a little man and my collection has dozens. You want this little man?" The biker held up poor Bill in front of the bouncer's face, taunting him. "You become MY little man." The older giant then stuffed the tiny visitor inside the inner pocket of his vest.

The biker noticed Scott's gaze flicker towards his vest as he stuffed his new pet inside. He closed his hand around the locket and pulled it out taut, not quite hard enough to break the chain but enough for it to dig into the bouncer's neck. Scott stood very still; he didn't want the chain to break and lose the locket. If that happened...

The older giant got real close and whispered into Scott's ear, "I just might have to make him part of my special collection. I mean, if you don't want him..."

Scott's eyes bulged and he stopped breathing for a moment. "You don't have to do that, Hank..."

"Sir. You're going to address me as Sir from now on."

"Yes, Sir."

"Good little man. I see you really want your new little friend. First things first, though." Hank gave the locket chain a slight tug. The bouncer gulped, knowing full well what relinquishing the locket would mean. But what choice did he have? No one ever saw nor heard from little men in Hank's special collection ever again. The bouncer reached up and unclasped the chain, letting the locket to free into the older biker's hand. The chain dangled loosely in Hank's fist.

The older giant wasted no time in claiming his new pet. Two in one day, and one of them a giant!

The bouncer's stomach lurched as it suddenly felt like it dropped out from under him. He got dizzy as his height rapidly diminished, causing the older man to shoot up into the sky. In a matter of moments, the former bouncer was only a few inches tall, gazing up at the colossal biker just as Bill had done only minutes ago. Hank loomed over the miniature bouncer for a few seconds before reaching down with a huge hand and snatching up the stunned little redhead.

Hank held the tiny bouncer up to his bearded face, smirking while peering intently at his new pet.

"Now, as promised, you will join your little friend."

12113122.content:
Scott stared at the enormous bearded face before him. He'd always been a big man; nothing could prepare him for being so small. He laid there, frozen in awe and fear. Hank would have been imposing to most normal-sized men. Now, to Scott, the biker's presence was overwhelming. The tiny bouncer never felt so subdued just by someone's presence. He suddenly regretted allowing himself to be shrunken by Hank. He would soon regret it even more.

Hank basked in his new capture, soaking in the fear and awe coming from the tiny man in his palm. Yes, capturing a giant was even more of a rush than what a normal little man gave. The biker would have to see if he could get any other giants to submit to becoming his pet. But for now, he had one giant-turned-pet to keep him occupied. It was certainly a special occasion. To celebrate his first-ever giant capture, he would make him part of his special collection.

Just as Scott was starting to wrap his head around his new size, it changed on him. If the tiny bouncer thought he was small before, soon his initial shrunken size would be gigantic. The bouncer shrank again and the giant's palm expanded from a fleshy platform into a grooved football field.

A deep chuckle rolled out of the giant biker. "Seeing that taking a giant as a pet is such a special occasion, I think you should become part of my special collection." The biker stuck his hand into his pants and he gathered a bit of precum on his fingertip. Just the thought of owning the tiny bouncer was causing him to leak!

"Special collection? No... No!" Scott now understood why no one ever saw or heard from people in the special collection; they were too small to find! And now he was going to become part of that collection. He looked around for somewhere to run, but up in the biker's palm, there was nowhere to go. As the tiny bouncer glanced around in panic, a colossal digit descended upon him. The finger was sticky and smelled strongly of musk and cum. The biker was using his own precum to adhere the tiny man to his finger.

Hank brought his finger up to his eye to get a better look at the twice-reduced former giant. A moan of arousal rumbled through the titanic biker. He could practically feel the panic of his new pet. "Don't worry, little man, you know the magic of this place will keep you safe. Of course, you know I can't change your size unless I'm here, so I wouldn't try to escape, or you'll be stuck at that size for the rest of your life. And don't worry about your little friend. He'll join you in my special collection as well. In fact, I'll make sure he's even smaller than you so you can feel like you're still a giant to someone. That's if you can find him." The biker inserted his fingertip in his bushy grey beard. With a tiny nudge he deposited Scott into the dense beard. "Welcome to your new home," the biker declared.

Scott got to his feet, standing on the new "ground." Sure enough, the magic of Jotunheim made the beard his new home and the skin of the giant's face was "down" to him. Thick grey "trees" surrounded the tiny bouncer. Even if Scott tried to escape, he doubt he could find his way out of the dense jungle of a beard he was trapped in. Given Hank was his only chance of ever growing again, Scott was not inclined to try to leave. And the little man he wanted was going to be even smaller than he was! Yeah, he would get him, if Scott could ever find him.

122.content:
A broad smile split the visage of the thickly muscled biker that approached you, his arms opened wide as he came in for an all too friendly hug, nearly lifting you off your feet. "OH, hell, don't you worry about these boys. They're just jealous that you managed to catch ol' red's eye, and on your first visit no less! What's yer name, kiddo?"

You were taken aback, staggering backwards as he was finally released from the overly familiar hug, looking up past the broad shelf of pectoral muscle that was at eye level at him as he stammered his name, feeling his cheeks flush already. "It's uh. . . it's William, sir. Bill to my friends. And. . . you said that was 'Red'? The bouncer?"

Another grin split the biker's face as he turned, draping an arm over your shoulders to guide you towards the door. "Oh. Oh, no. That's just what I call him. If you was told to call him 'sir' you're better off doin' just that. But don't worry. I'll keep an eye out for ol' red until he's done clocking out. Let's just get inside before you freeze out here or, worse yet, someone else snatches you up for playtime."

Surely a newcomer to the bar wasn't that rare an occurrence that they'd be fighting over you like that. Maybe it was just because it was so chilly tonight. Or maybe your new 'friend' had already had one too many.

You can't help but chuckle under your breath at that, even as the door swings open. Your momentary reprieve wiped away by the brilliant, overwhelming onslaught of colors and lights that washed over you as you were ushered through the doorway. You half-expected a cacophony of noise, music and raucous laughter as the door opened, instead, utter silence met you, only your own heartbeat thudding in your ears as your vision slowly cleared.

But what lie before you now. . . it couldn't be right. The building's interior stretched further and higher than should be possible, both in terms of common sense and the very laws of physics; you knew for a fact it wasn't this large on the outside!

One by one the people in the bar slowly turned to look in your direction, looming colossi each seated at the bar or milling on the dance floor, their attentions immediately drawn to the newcomer that had scampered through the door.

You were about to back your way through the door when another figure appeared. You gaped as a boot crashed down beside you, spinning on your heel to recover as your head whipped upwards to try to take in the form of your new biker friend who now loomed overhead as he grinned, his face mostly obscured now by that thick beard and the pecs that stretched his shirt far too thin. "Don' you worry, lil' Billy. I promised I'd keep ya secure for Red an' that still stands."

But just how massive was this figure before you?

Bill looked up in awe, hardly believing his own eyes, but every other sense confirmed what happened. Everything was colossal in size inside Jotunheim, unimaginably so. The giant biker's voice shocked Bill out of his reverie. "What do you mean, true size?"

"You're lucky that Jotunheim lets me hear tiny men like you, lil' Billy. Otherwise us giants wouldn't be able to hear someone so small. You're at your true size. Everyone has their own sense of their natural size in relation to us giants. You must love your giants at a truly colossal size. Of course, Red has some influence on this as well, having a sense of his own size compared to humans. Looks like you and ol' Red were made for each other. Good thing I decided to help you out. At your size Red may not have ever found you. Don't worry, ol' Buck here will keep safe for Red as promised."

Buck gently scraped Bill up onto the tip of his index finger. The titan slow stood up and held his finger up to his eye. The orb was huge and its gaze somewhat unsettling. At least Bill didn't sense any malice; on the contrary, the giant seemed to exude amusement. "So tiny... I'm jealous that Red claimed you first."

Bill felt himself collide with the torso of a larger man, presumably one of the bikers from the lot. A gruff, deep voice rumbled, "Welcome to Jotunheim, little man." Bill tried to squirm free but a second arm came around front across the chest holding him firmly in place.

The bouncer smirked at the scene. "Guess you got an offer you can't refuse. Maybe he'll let me play with you another time." The bouncer reached over and opened the door. It looked more like a barn than a bar; all Bill could see was wide wooden planks for a floor and tall wooden pillars. He couldn't believe the building could be so open on the inside. Where was the bar? Something huge came into view and left just as suddenly. It was a black pillar with a rubber bottom. It almost looked like a boot, but that couldn't be right.

"Let's go little man." The biker behind Bill herded him towards the door.
13.title: was approached by another biker while deciding.

choices: Mickey holds on becomes Big Jim's pet with Bill.
Mickey slips out (follow Bill and Big Jim).
Mickey slips out (follow Mickey and his new owner).
132.content:
"I've been waiting to get my hands on a little guy like you." The biker pushed Bill in through the threshold, but just as suddenly the biker felt himself pushed in as well. Bill felt the larger man bump into him and the both fell through the door onto the hardwood floor. Before the door slammed shut they heard the bouncer chuckling, "Have fun, little men." The biker rolled himself off of Bill and onto his back. Bill groaned as he rolled over himself. He finally got a look at the stocky biker that came up behind him. He was stout though a bit shorter than Bill. The biker was wearing a white tank top and well-worn blue jeans with black motorcycle boots. Black bands adorned his wrists and a chain was around his neck. Just as they were both getting their bearings a giant hand came into view reaching to grasp them.

"No..." the biker mumbled as he was being surrounded by fingers the size of tree trunks. "No! I was supposed to be big!" he shouted in panic.

The meaty, calloused giant hand scooped both the biker and Bill up and lifted them off the floor. The little men nearly got sick before the fleshy elevator ride stopped before a chest covered in white fur. A harness ring sat at the base of the valley between huge pecs over a firm hairy gut, holding together the black straps the ran under the giant's pecs and over his shoulders. "Well, good things do come to those who wait. I didn't think I'd get two little men at the door."

The giant's voice drew the gaze of the little men upward. A bald head with bright blue eyes, a wide nose, and a dense bushy white beard was gazing back down at them. "And a fine pair of little men you are. My name's Jim, but everyone calls me Big Jim. What're your names, little men?"

"No, this is some kind of mistake. I'm not supposed to be a little man. He," the biker pointed at Bill, "is supposed to be my little man."

"No mistake here, little man. It's finder's keepers here in Jotunheim. You may have been a big man in Midgard, but you're with the giants now. Now answer my question."

"Bill! My name is Bill," the frightened little man yelled out. The last thing he wanted was to get on this giant's bad side.

The giant's eyes looked over at Bill and he smiled briefly. He then brought his gaze back upon the biker. "Your turn."

"No! Just let me go! I won't ever come back! Please!"

Bill saw Big Jim frown though it was difficult to tell through the heavy facial hair. "That's not a name. If you don't have one I'll have to give you one. I need something to call my new pet. Let's see...Mickey. Yeah, I like that. Well, now that introductions are done, let's get going. I can't wait to start playing with you."

"No, I'm not a pet! Please...please make me big again..."

Big Jim ignored the pleading and plucked Bill from his hand. The giant brought the little man to his chest and pushed him under one of the tight harness straps. "Hang tight, little Bill." Big Jim did the same with the stocky little biker in the opposite strap. The giant biker rubbed the little men before grabbing his vest and heading out from the bar. Bill looked around as he was brought along on this unusual carnival ride. Even though they had just left the bar, he and Mickey didn't return to their normal sizes. They were still tiny pinned against the giant's furry chest. The chest hair was deep and dense and the little men were nearly hidden by it, let alone the harness.

"Heading out already, Big Jim?" The giant biker turned to face the bouncer. The redheaded giant looked huge before, but he was unbelievably massive now. Even scarier was when Bill realized the giant he was pinned against made the bouncer look small. The bouncer smirked down at the little men behind the harness straps.

"Yup. Going home to play with my new pets." The older giant stroked the two little men again. Mickey squirmed, trying to get away from the probing finger. The little man's efforts and the warmth of Big Jim's body were making him all sweaty. "Help!" the tiny biker yelled to the bouncer. "Get me out of here!"

"Feisty one your got there. Sure you can handle him?" the bouncer joked.

"Little Mickey here? Yeah, he won't be no trouble. Just needs some training is all."

"Well, if you ever want someone to take him off your hands, you know where to find me." The bouncer leaned down in close. Even though he was the smaller giant of the two, he was still incredibly huge. The redhead inhaled deeply and snaked out his tongue to lick little Mickey. "Mmm...wish I got a chance at you. Both of you." The giant bouncer's gaze shifted over to Bill. "Take good care of your new pets. I hope you let me play with them sometime, Big Jim." The massive bouncer then shifted back up on his stool.

"I think that can be arranged sometime, Scott. See you around."

Everyone gave Big Jim a wide berth as he walked to his bike. Bill imagined it was due to the giant's size, but he wondered if the others knew about him, too. As Big Jim raised his right arm to sling his vest on, the harness strap Mickey was under loosened a bit and the little man started slipping. Mickey had continued squirming, trying to free himself before being carried away from the bar. Now he was caught between a choice of slipping free and falling a long way or holding on for dear life and being stuck tiny with the giant biker.
132.title: They enter together. (Both shrink)

choices: Big Jim makes dinner.
Big Jim relaxes with a cigar.
Big Jim gets ready for bed.
1322.content:
Bill watched as Mickey struggled. At this point Bill wasn't sure if the other little man was struggling to get free or keep hold, but it became moot as gravity won and Mickey tumbled off of the giant's body. Bill couldn't see what happened to Mickey and Big Jim didn't seem to react at all to the loss of his second pet. Were they so insignificant that the giant didn't even notice? Bill shivered despite the warm space in which he was trapped. Bill could barely move but he grabbed some of the copious amounts of chest fur surrounding him.

With a deafening roar of the bike engine, Big Jim took off with his new prize. It had been a while since the giant had claimed some little men for his own and he was eager to play with his new toys. He had seen Mickey lurking around the bar before; that little man was one of the cowardly lot too afraid to journey into Jotunheim. Bill on the other hand looked to be new around here and Big Jim looked forward to his earnest reactions to this situation.

Bill wasn't sure how much time passed but eventually the bike stopped and the engine was turned off. He could feel Big Jim moving but with the vest blocking his view the little man couldn't tell where they were or where they were going. Bill heard the fumbling of keys and figured they must be at Big Jim's house. After the sound of the door opening, closing, and locking, the giant removed his vest and hung it on a wooden coat rack.

"We're home little men." One of Big Jim's large hands pulled Bill from his temporary prison but the giant felt the tug on his chest hair. "Let go, little Billy. Big Jim's got you. Now for your little friend..." The giant's voice trailed off as he searched under the other harness strap for his lost pet. "Damn, little fucker must have slipped out. His loss."

Bill was chilled by the casual indifference the giant had towards his shrunken men. The shudder didn't go unnoticed by the giant.

"You cold, little Billy? Big Jim will warm you right up. Stay here for now and you'll be warm in no time." Big Jim pull out the front of his jeans and Bill could see the giant went commando as the giant deposited him into the crotch. The giant was hard and heat pulsated from the huge cock. "There you go, little man. I'll get you out in a moment when I'm ready for you."
1322.title: Mickey slips out (follow Bill and Big Jim).

choices: He falls and the bouncer disappears into the bar and the door closes.
He falls though the door and into the middle of a crowd of giants (Bill shrinks)
He falls though the door and ends up in the bouncers hand.(Bill shrunken)
Bill  sees little men walking around the floor. (Bill giant)
Catches himself on the bouncers arm
14.content: Bill waits around for a bit. The stares from the other bikers, looking him up and down like he's on a menu, started to make him nervous. Bill gets up and decides that he has changed his mind about staying. He goes to approach the Bouncer to ask for his stuff back. At that same time the bouncer moves to the door to enter the bar. Bill runs to catch his attention before he goes in. Just as he's about to say something Bill trips on a loss board and falls forward.
14.title: has second thoughts and asks for his stuff back.

info.brief_description: A man gets much more than he bargained for when visiting a new bar.
info.description:
Bill moved to a new town and was looking for a place to hang out and meet some guys. He saw motorcycles and large men hanging around outside of an unassuming brick building. A few flickering lights shone on the sign above the door proclaiming the establishment to be Jotunheim. Giant's Home. Bill had a good feeling about this place and decided to check it out.

*****

This is a gay male macro story. I ask that it stays to men only, please. No women and no children (children being people less than 18 years of age).
